title: 106_s844
content: Liability of business entities providing use of a motor vehicle or aircraft. Definitions for terms related to liability of business entities providing use of a motor vehicle or aircraft include: aircraft, business entity, gross negligence, intentional misconduct, and motor vehicle. The term "motor vehicle" is defined as provided in section 30102(6) of title 49, United States Code. The term "nonprofit organization" refers to organizations described in section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code or not-for-profit organizations operated for public benefit. The term "State" includes several States, the District of Columbia, and various territories or possessions. Limitation on Liability: A business entity shall not be liable for injury or death resulting from the use of its motor vehicle or aircraft by a nonprofit organization outside of business scope, if authorized by the business entity. Subsection (b) does not apply to injury or death resulting from gross negligence or intentional misconduct by a business entity, including crimes of violence or acts of international terrorism. The Act preempts state laws inconsistent with it, except for those providing additional protection for business entities in cases of injury or death. Subparagraphs (A) and (B) of subsection (b)(1) apply. Nothing in this Act shall supersede any Federal or State health or safety law. This Act shall not apply to any civil action in a State court against a volunteer, nonprofit organization, or governmental entity if the State enacts a statute declaring the election of nonapplicability to such civil action.
